Function Documentation

int spi_close ( port_t  port)

This functions closes the specified SPI port.

int spi_getattr ( port_t  port,
spi_attr_t *  attr 
)

This function gets the SPI attributes from the specified SPI port.

int spi_open ( port_t  port)

This function opens the specified SPI port (e.g. /dev/spi0).

int spi_read ( port_t  port,
void *  buf,
int  nbyte 
)

This function reads data from the SPI. If used with spi_setduplex(), this can be a full-duplex operation.

Returns
Number of bytes read.
int spi_setattr ( port_t  port,
spi_attr_t *  attr 
)

This function sets the SPI attributes for port.

int spi_setduplex ( port_t  port,
void *  buf 
)

This function sets an internal pointer to a buffer to use for full duplex operation. For example, when using spi_write(), data that is read from the bus will be stored in this pointer. If buf is set to NULL, the SPI bus operates in half-duplex mode.

int spi_swap ( port_t  port,
int  byte 
)

This function simulatenously puts/gets a byte from the SPI bus.

Returns
byte read from the SPI
int spi_write ( port_t  port,
const void *  buf,
int  nbyte 
)

This function writes data to the SPI. If used with spi_setduplex(), this can be a full-duplex operation.

Returns
Number of bytes read.
